title: Khelemba Singh
text:
Irungbam Khelemba Singh (born 1985) is a retired Indian professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Career.
Early career.
Khelemba Singh hails from <a href="Imphal">Imphal</a>. He had started playing <a href="association%20football">football</a> since his schooldays. His talent didn't go unnoticed and he soon played in the Manipur League for SSC Sekta & Sagaoband United. In 2004, he joined <a href="Guwahati">Guwahati</a>'s <a href="Green%20Valley%20F.C.">Green Valley F.C.</a> and then played in the I-League 2nd division for Assam State Electricity Board (ASEB), the same year. After joining <a href="Churchill%20Brothers%20S.C.">Churchill Brothers</a> in 2005, Khelemba played for four other I-League clubs <a href="Chirag%20United%20Club%20Kerala">Viva Kerala</a>, <a href="East%20Bengal%20F.C.">East Bengal</a>, <a href="Air%20India%20%28football%20club%29">Air India</a> & <a href="Salgaocar%20S.C.">Salgaocar</a> before joining McDowell Mohun Bagan.
Viva Kerala.
In the <a href="I-League">I-League</a> match at <a href="Calicut">Calicut</a> against <a href="Air%20India%20%28football%20club%29">Air India</a>, when Sulley Mussah had fouled <a href="Badmus%20Babatunde">Badmus Babatunde</a>, <a href="Chirag%20United%20Club%20Kerala">Viva Kerala</a> captain Khelemba Singh scored from a 40-yard long stunning free kick, a thriller which finally ended in a 3–2 win for the home team.
Mumbai.
On 24 November 2013 it was announced that Khelemba has signed for Mumbai on loan from IMG Realiance with three other players <a href="Mohammed%20Rafi%20%28footballer%29">Mohammed Rafi</a>, <a href="Pappachen%20Pradeep">N.P. Pradeep</a> and Peter Costa.
He made his debut on 2 December 2013 against <a href="East%20Bengal%20F.C.">East Bengal F.C.</a> at the <a href="Shree%20Shiv%20Chhatrapati%20Sports%20Complex">Balewadi Sports Complex</a> in which he played the whole match as Mumbai won the match 3–2.
